affected_areas.area_description: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for tonight.

What:
Significantly reduced visibility at times in bursts of heavy snow and blowing snow.
Local snowfall accumulations up to 5 cm.

When:
Tonight.

Additional information:
Lake effect snow and strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 50 km/h will continue tonight. The fresh snow and strong winds will produce significantly reduced visibility at times.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly. Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Road closures are possible.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. If you must drive, be prepared for areas of poor visibility.

affected_areas.area_description: Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for tonight.

What:
Significantly reduced visibility at times in heavy snow and blowing snow.
Local snowfall accumulations up to 5 cm.

When:
Tonight.

Additional information:
Lake effect snow and strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 50 km/h will continue tonight. The fresh snow and strong winds will produce significantly reduced visibility at times.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

affected_areas.area_description: Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for tonight and Sunday morning.

What:
Near zero visibility at times in bursts of heavy snow and blowing snow.
Additional snowfall accumulations 4 to 8 cm.

When:
Tonight through Sunday morning.

Additional information:
Lake effect snow and northwesterly winds gusting up to 50 km/h will continue tonight into Sunday morning. The fresh snow and strong winds will produce significantly reduced visibility at times. Conditions are expected to improve through the day on Sunday.

###

Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Road closures are possible.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Prepare for quickly changing and deteriorating travel conditions. Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.
